## R Markdown

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

```{r cars}
summary(cars)
```

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
plot(pressure)
```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.

```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(here)
library(janitor)
library(readxl)
```

```{r}
inverts <- read_excel(here("data", "inverts.xlsx"))
view(inverts)
names(inverts)
summary (inverts)
```

```{r}
inverts_long<-pivot_longer(data = inverts,
                           cols='2016':'2018',
                           names_to="year",
                           values_to="sp_count")
```

```{r}
inverts_long<- inverts_long%>%
  mutate(year=as.numeric(year))
```

```{r}
inverts_wide<-inverts_long%>%
  pivot_wider(names_from=common_name,
              values_from=sp_count)
```

```{r}
inverts_wide<- inverts_wide%>%
  clean_names()
names(inverts_wide)
```

```{r}
inverts_unite<-inverts_long%>%
  unite(col="site_year",
       c(site,year),
       sep= "_")
```

```{r}
inverts_moyr<-inverts_long%>%
  unite(col="month_year",
        c(month, year),
        sep= "_")
```

```{r}
inverts_triples_unit <-inverts_long%>%
  unite(col="year_site_name",
        c(year,site,common_name),
        sep= "-")
```

```{r}
inverts_sep<- inverts_unite%>%
  tidyr:: separate(site_year, into=c("my_site", "my_year"))
```

```{r}
ca_abbr<- inverts%>%
  mutate(
    common_name=
      str_replace(common_name,
                  pattern="california",
                  replacement = "CA")
  )
```
